body:
have you tried 
`--producer-property security.protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT   --producer-property fetch.min.bytes=2`
?
I commented on the JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3775
@aartigupta perhaps the PR name should be "KAFKA-3715: add granular metrics per node"? The JIRA number is usually part of the PR name. Minor thing but just for consistency.

Ya it worked. 
bin/kafka-console-consumer.sh  --new-consumer --zookeeper host:port --topic mytopic --from-beginning --bootstrap-server host:port --consumer-property security.protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT --consumer.property fetch.min.bytes=2
@edoardocomar  @harshach  @ijuma I have updated the JIRA KAFKA-3748.  #1459 Can you review it.
@bbejeck Could you rebase? Seems some other commits are squashed in this PR.

This new patch looks very promising. Thanks @bbejeck ! I left some more comments.

Could we add some integration tests (please see examples in streams/test/integration) to validate the case that, for example, with three source streams, two with pattern and one with concrete topic list, 1) the consumer subscription reflects all the matched topics, and when 2) some new topics are added matching the pattern, or 3) some existing topics are deleted matching the pattern, they are correctly reflected during the rebalance, i.e. stream partition assignor?
I think #1459 supersedes this one @bharatviswa504 right ?
Thanks, I prefer this solution to #1409
cc @granthenke. Would appreciate your feedback on this PR when you get a chance.
@ijuma Thanks for review. I have updated code as your comments.
@ijuma @junrao please can you have a look.thanks
@edoardocomar Yes, with this user can override any consumer property.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Just left a minor comment.

@guozhangwang 
Thanks for the feedback.  I'll get to work on this soon.
@lindong28 I updated the PR based on the feedback and the discussion.
Thanks @vahidhashemian, LGTM. @ijuma Do you have time to review this patch?
Thanks @ijuma , updated the readme file.
LGTM.
Merged to trunk.
One concern I had was the cost of string concatenation for this metric. All other metrics are simple numbers. Is this a valid concern @junrao?

Some thoughts:
1. For persistent store operations (RocksDB), today it has a in-memory LRU cache inside by default and hence may cause its read / write operations to be very cheap compared with its metrics recording operation. In KIP-63 (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3776) we are extracting the cache out of RocksDB and hence this may no longer be the case.
2. Approximate the metrics globally like I suggested before may not be a good solution as there can be cases where fine grained metrics are needed (actually we are working on a separate ticket to add even more metrics: #1446 ).
3. About tuning metrics on / off, I agree that we'd better have some mechanism to only turn on part of the metrics for production deployment, while allow users to keep track of all metrics in the development phase yet. Today all state stores are wrapped by the MeteredStore class in order to provide all the metrics, and hence it is easier to make such wrapper optional (for example, by default we do NOT "meter" any stores, and users need to explicitly specify the state store names that they want to monitor).

As for this PR, we can still take the optimization on the consumer fetcher as @ijuma commented, while at the same time create a new story ticket for making a clear metrics hierarchy, and allow users to turn on at any level with a reasonable default, for example:

level0 (stream thread global): per-record process / punctuate latency, commit latency, poll latency, etc

level1 (per processor node, and per state store): IO latency, per-record .. latency, forward throughput, etc.

And by default we only turn on level0.

Thanks for the patch. Could you fix the compilation error?

[ant:checkstyle] intellij/kafka/clients/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/clients/producer/internals/RecordAccumulator.java:27:8: Unused import - org.apache.kafka.common.metrics.stats.Rate.
 FAILED
Can we please use a separate JIRA and PR for the consumer improvements? That will make it clearer and we can backport it to 0.10.0.1.
@junrao any thoughts on whether we should add a metric to replace the buffer exhausted one?

@ijuma : Yes, that's a good point. Instead of exposing this through jmx, another option is to add a new BrokerStatRequest and we can return all useful statistics in the response. This can potentially be useful for admin tools like partition reassignment.
@ijuma : Yes, instead of removing buffer-exhausted-records sensor, we can probably just update it when BufferPool throws a TimeoutException.
@junrao Thank you for your feedback. I updated the PR based on your suggestions.

This sounds great. I think levelled metrics and the ability to toggle them seems like a good solution.

I will fork off a new JIRA/PR for the fetcher changes and will consider this PR closed.
Thank you for the reviews, merged to trunk and 0.10.0 branches (KAFKA-3396 which would be good to backport requires these changes for the tests to work).
@edoardocomar, can you please rebase this now that #1455 was merged?
@junrao Thanks. I will upload a new PR.
Yeah, I screwed this up when re-basing, will open a new one.
Fetcher JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3785

@ijuma This is just one proposal for tackling the problem I mentioned in JIRA. Another related issue resolved here is that Kafka Streams may prefer a different default value for some of the underlying configs.

Let me know what do you think, and if there is a better approach, I'd be OK to go with that as well.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
We may also want to update the JIRA ticket for (this) PR.

@becketqin, any reason not to do this? cc @junrao 

Assuming that this is the right thing to do, we should include a test.
FYI: Seems like there's a vim swap file in your PR (streams/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/.TimeWindows.java.swp).
Thanks, LGTM. Merging to trunk and 0.10.0.

@ewencp thanks for the clarification.So the options are,
1. Keep the current default (old consumer) and just display a warning message that the new consumer would be made default in a subsequent release.
2. Make new consumer as default and support both --new-consumer and --old-consumer. As a workaround to not break existing scripts, switch to old consumer if `zookeeper url` is provided (current default option) and display the warning message.

Option 2 may be better since the new consumer can be made default without breaking existing scripts. If it sounds ok I can make the necessary changes.

Thanks @ijuma with your changes in #1455 the only fix needed for this defect was to 
Set OffsetsTopicReplicationFactorProp to 3 like MinInSyncReplicasProp
without which a consumer could not consume vai subscribe.

The other changes are no longer needed

LGTM @edoardocomar. Can you please update the PR description to match the commit message? The PR message is what gets used by our PR merge script in the merge commit.

I'll merge it to trunk and 0.10.0 once you do that and the tests pass. Merging to 0.10.0 to make it easier to backport KAFKA-3396.

Good catch. However, I believe this can be simplified (avoiding the additional `if` in the loop). The problem seem to be, that the `startWindow` value is not computed correctly. I think, it should be `windowStart = (Math.max(0, timestamp - this.size + this.advance) / this.advance) * this.advance;`.

Does this make sense?

Hi @ijuma all the tests pass for me - unlike in the Jenkins build. How do I re-kick a Jenkins build?
thanks
Yes, that makes sense. We should include this in the 0.10.0 branch.
I'll run the tests locally. Can you please not repeat the PR title in the description?
done thx

Thank you so much for comments, @ewencp.
I fixed my PR and confirmed there aren't garbled characters in my environment.
LGTM

@arunmahadevan For option 2, I think you need to be very careful. If you go that route, it seems like the `--new-consumer` and `--old-consumer` flags don't really do anything beyond having `--zookeeper` and `--bootstrap-server` opts. You could "default" to new consumer in the sense that if `--zookeeper` is not provided, any error messages would say that the new consumer parameters are required. This would guide new users of the command to the new consumer version, although clearly some users will still need the old consumer versions if they still have old consumer groups.

What's unclear to me is whether including the `--old-consumer` flag makes much sense since a `--zookeeper` is required in that case anyway; it just makes the decision explicit and can help guide the user re: required arguments if the help message explains to select via `--old-consumer` and `--new-consumer` first, then gives help customized to each case.

Thanks @ijuma , I have modified the apache Jenkins accordingly:

```
kafka-trunk-jdk7
kafka-trunk-jdk8
kafka-0.10.0-jdk7
kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7
```

@hachikuji Thanks again for your time reviewing the PR multiple times.
cc @ewencp @ijuma

I have updated the pull request with the suggested changes.

@mjsax thanks for the calculation
Thanks for the PR. I wonder if we can extend our compression tests to include some data generated by the C snappy library?
Maybe even an example including this pattern that doesn't seem to happen with the Java library.
I made the changes discussed. Just waiting for EC2 access so I can run system tests.
LGTM, merged to trunk and 0.10.0.
@xiaotao183, are you willing to add a test to cover the fix?

@ijuma I had considered adding a test. And I agree tests to make sure there are no issues in the future are good. But I wonder if Kafka is the right place for these tests. I think its more appropriate for snappy-java or the clients using the c bindings to have integration tests that ensure they are working. The issue didn't occur when using the Kafka jvm clients. 

snappy-java added a unit test to ensure this issue doesn't happen again: https://github.com/xerial/snappy-java/commit/60cc0c2e1d1a76ae2981d0572a5164fcfdfba5f1

IMO, Snappy-java would be the best place, followed by Kafka (we support many clients, not just the Java one) and last the other clients.

The issue is that we keep getting regressions when upgrading snappy-java (even when it's a patch release update), so I was trying to think of ways of reducing the risk. Otherwise, we may end up not upgrading again due to the risk.

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/460/console

No problem @vahidhashemian !
Can you please rebase this now that #1425 has been merged?

@guozhangwang 
Made all changes per comments.

> Could we add some integration tests

@guozhangwang 
With respect to the integration tests, I just need to migrate the ones I have locally to the branch.
I have questions regarding adding/deleting topics.   Is the behavior expected to by dynamic? When I add a topic that matches the pattern I need to restart the stream to get the new topic picked up.
And deleting a topic while the stream is running causes the program to crash with NullPointerException @`org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata.getClusterForCurrentTopics(Metadata.java:257)`. Starting the stream again resets everything and the topic is dropped successfully.

EDIT: I'm looking into fixing these issues now to allow for dynamic behavior

EDIT 2: Fixed the NullPointerException when deleting a topic that was part of the KStreams (the NPE was occurring whether the topic was named or matched by regex).  The partition assignment is removed for the current topics and a new "generation" is created, but the StreamPartitionsAssignor does not kick in to re-assign the partitions  

Log from KafkaServer after topic delete:
`[2016-06-04 21:18:36,556] INFO Deleted log for partition [topic-A,0] in /tmp/kafka-logs/topic-A-0. (kafka.log.LogManager)
[2016-06-04 21:18:36,723] INFO [GroupCoordinator 0]: Preparing to restabilize group regex_id with old generation 4 (kafka.coordinator.GroupCoordinator)
[2016-06-04 21:18:36,723] INFO [GroupCoordinator 0]: Stabilized group regex_id generation 5 (kafka.coordinator.GroupCoordinator)
[2016-06-04 21:18:36,725] INFO [GroupCoordinator 0]: Assignment received from leader for group regex_id for generation 5 (kafka.coordinator.GroupCoordinator)
[2016-06-04 21:23:36,851] INFO [GroupCoordinator 0]: Preparing to restabilize group regex_id with old generation 5 (kafka.coordinator.GroupCoordinator)
[2016-06-04 21:23:36,851] INFO [GroupCoordinator 0]: Stabilized group regex_id generation 6 (kafka.coordinator.GroupCoordinator)
[2016-06-04 21:23:36,853] INFO [GroupCoordinator 0]: Assignment received from leader for group regex_id for generation 6 (kafka.coordinator.GroupCoordinator)
[2016-06-04 21:26:04,998] INFO [Group Metadata Manager on Broker 0]: Removed 0 expired offsets in 0 milliseconds. (kafka.coordinator.GroupMetadataManager)`

Log from KStream after topic delete:
`[2016-06-04 21:18:36,721] DEBUG Updated cluster metadata version 4 to Cluster(nodes = [oddball.home:9092 (id: 0 rack: null)], partitions = [Partition(topic = topic-1, partition = 0, leader = 0, replicas = [0,], isr = [0,], Partition(topic = topic-Z, partition = 0, leader = 0, replicas = [0,], isr = [0,], Partition(topic = topic-2, partition = 0, leader = 0, replicas = [0,], isr = [0,], Partition(topic = topic-B, partition = 0, leader = 0, replicas = [0,], isr = [0,], Partition(topic = topic-C, partition = 0, leader = 0, replicas = [0,], isr = [0,]]) (org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata:181)
[2016-06-04 21:18:36,721] INFO Revoking previously assigned partitions [topic-Z-0, topic-1-0, topic-2-0, topic-B-0, topic-C-0] for group regex_id (org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerCoordinator:280)
[2016-06-04 21:18:36,721] INFO Removing a task 0_0 (org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.internals.StreamThread:614)`

I'll continue to work this...
@ijuma Sure, will do
@ijuma Thanks for explanation. That's  make more sense for code readability. I have updated code
Thanks for the PR, LGTM. Merged to trunk.
Thanks for the PR, good catch. Can we also add a test that calls `conditionalDeletePath` with the wrong version and checks that `false` is returned?

Also, can you increase the timeout for `waitAndVerifyAcls` in `testHighConcurrencyDeletionOfResourceAcls` and `testHighConcurrencyModificationOfResourceAcls`? We sometimes get transient failures because of that (in fact the build for this PR failed with that error coincidentally).
@ijuma test case added
Thanks for the clarification
LGTM, merging to trunk.
Thanks for the PR @rekhajoshm. Merge conflicts need to be resolved in this PR.

I did some code archeology and the regression in snappy-java happened in May 2015 (I bisected): https://github.com/xerial/snappy-java/commit/ac168dfdce76fb077403973a2716f1def839db7e

The issue has been in Kafka since November 2015: https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/8f6ffe1c28d43bebf1cef7198c1e154a2adc92c3

There are some plans to run the Kafka system tests with other clients and that would hopefully show issues like this. In the meantime, we should probably avoid upgrading the Snappy library (even if they added a test for this particular issue).

LGTM, merging to trunk and 0.10.0.
Ran the tests locally and they passed (the PR build had transient failures).
Thanks for the review @ijuma rebased, fixed. Please have a look. thanks.
Sorry missed this earlier @ijuma , closing this. thanks.
@ijuma PR #50  was done a while back, changes after rebase.Please have a look. thanks
Seems not an issue related to this PR, but Jenkins slave issue; (Slave went offline during the build)
retest this please
@ijuma please review again
@ijuma Thanks for your help.

@ijuma done

Thanks for the PR @rekhajoshm. I left a couple of minor comments. Also, the PR title and description are used in the merged commit message. Can you please edit them to be:

PR title: `KAFKA-724: Allow automatic socket.send.buffer from operating system in SocketServer`

PR description: `If socket.receive.buffer.bytes/socket.send.buffer.bytes are set to -1, use the OS defaults.`
@xiaotao183 Thanks! LGTM, merging to 0.10.0 and trunk.

Sorry, I just realised that the test is in `core/src/test/scala/kafka/tools/MirrorMakerTest.scala`, but it should be under `core/src/test/scala/unit/kafka/tools/MirrorMakerTest.scala`. The package should still be `kafka.tools`. Can you please fix that?
@ijuma done
Review by @guozhangwang.
Thanks, tests passed locally. Merged to trunk and 0.10.0 branches.
Thanks, it's mostly fine, I left a few minor comments.
Review by @guozhangwang
One more thing: we should also update the documentation in `KafkaConfig` and `CommonClientConfigs` stating that if the value is `-1`, the OS default is used.
The latest update seems fine to me, @hachikuji can you please check?
For the benefit of others who see this, I asked @rnpridgeon to verify that what is being said here works as expected before we merge the PR.

I filed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3763 for removing deprecated APIs in 0.11.0.

Personally, I don't see a lot of value in filing separate JIRAs as it will never be exhaustive and one needs to search the code when the time comes anyway. However, for cases where we already have a PR (like this one), then it makes sense to have a separate JIRA. I would suggest linking such JIRAs to KAFKA-3763.
